query: Can non-students apply for the Virtual Participation Award?
output: No, non-students cannot apply for the Virtual Participation Award. The eligibility criteria specify that an applicant must be a student connected to a university or research laboratory in an economically developing country, as designated by ACM.

query: Can I attend the conference remotely?
output: No, as of April 26, due to logistical situations, the conference is not able to accommodate anymore remote presentations. All speakers, presenters, and organizers are expected to attend in person. For exceptional reasons, a proxy may be assigned who must be in person.

query: Will the conference proceedings be published, and if so, how can one access them?
output: Yes, the conference proceedings will be published. They will be available through the SIGWEB. Every paper can be accessed without charge by clicking on the links of the paper on this page: https://www.sigweb.org/conferences/acm-sigweb-conferences/the-web-conference. Selected papers will also be published in the Companion Proceedings of The Web Conference 2023 and made available through the ACM Digital Library. The proceedings of the workshops will be included in the conference proceedings (companion volume). The official publication date is the date the proceedings are made available in the ACM Digital Library.

query: How can I contact the conference organizers if I have further questions or concerns?
output: You can contact the general chairs of the conference at chairs2023@thewebconf.org. If your question or concern is about sponsorship, communications, proceedings, workshops, or the program committee, you can contact the respective chairs at sponsorship2023@thewebconf.org, communication2023@thewebconf.org, proceedings2023@thewebconf.org, workshop2023@thewebconf.org, or pc-chairs2023@thewebconf.org.
